item.description:
Belle toujours by Manoel de Oliveira (France, 2006, 70 min.).

Crafting the sequel to director Luis Bunuel and screenwriter Jean-Claude Carriès 1967 classic Belle de Jour, master filmmaker Manoel de Oliveria reunites the film's leading characters, Henri (Michel Piccoli) and Séverine, played this time by veteran actress Bulle Ogier. Belle toujours is a homage, a parody and also a lovely meditation (by a director well into his 90's) on the passage of time and the persistence of desire." (The New York Times). The film has received mixed reviews. French with English subtitles.

MFA members, seniors, and students $8; general admission $9.

This film is being hosted by Nicole, your friendly meetup organizer, who will be holding a sign toward the front of the theater during the credits. After the film, we will head off to a local cafe for discussion.
item.name: Belle Toujours @ MFA
